Has anyone had any success with Kon Boot yet?

I've only tried the USB hack so far and I get to Kon Boot menu and it runs through and then cycles back to the menu, the same problem as many other people so I think I may give the CD boot a go and hope that doesn't have the same issue. If anyone has this same problem search on google for 'irongeekusbkonbootfiles.zip' you may get more success than me with hacking password from USB booting.

Thanks for sharing Anon.

Worked great for me on 3 different computers so far. I'm using it on a usb sandisk drive formatted as fat32. it runs through just fine reboots and any user account password can be bypassed just by hitting enter on the password prompt screen.
this worked for me from cd ISO, on windows 7 ultimate
its working good thank you

Don't be a tool box like me and think that the burn wasn't correct or didn't work simply because Windoze can't see any files on the disc.  I burned 6 copies using Nero, Imgburn, on three different computers before I realized that they were all fine and worked, just that the files are not seen or recognized by Windows.  In fact some OS kept trying to act like they could write to the discs, even though they were closed.  Trust the Verify options that it is actually correctly burned or just simply try it out rather than assuming there was a problem.

Oh one more thing, it worked on XP,Vista, and Windows 7 except when there was a dual booted Vista over XP system.  There it would do nothing and I tried all six different copies.

and i have a query that after login we can't change admin password, how to reset it ...??? because i can't use cd again and agin..!!

@hemantfms 
try this
1. press winkey+r
2. type "net user username *"
3. enter new password and confirm

works, super simple, small file size, how much more do you want 
win 7 x64

@hemantfms thairs a help pdf. read it. just make a new adim. account pull the disk out restart the pc. use your new account to reset the password for the old one. delete the new account and your back to normal
